answers.answer: The website provides information on how to manage in a new city and identifies who can help you in Sibiu.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The provided content only lists contact details (phone numbers and email) for the Sibiu County Immigration Office, without specifying its services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: Emergency services in Sibiu can be contacted by calling the emergency number 112.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: The provided content only lists contact numbers for the National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania, without specifying the type of support offered.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: The content states that information is required for the accommodation, board, and integration support program, but it does not specify what that information is.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Sibiu'.

answers.answer: The content indicates that details on how and where to buy public transport tickets in Sibiu are available by accessing more information, but it does not provide the direct answer.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Public transport in Sibiu'.

answers.answer: The content states that you can go to the County Emergency Clinical Hospital Sibiu if you need medical services, but it does not specify what particular services are available there.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: The content indicates that more information about healthcare in Romania is available, but it does not explain how it functions directly.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: The A.L.E.G. Association offers free psychosocial support to Ukrainian refugee women in Sibiu, including translation into Ukrainian.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The International Rescue Committee provides psychological assistance to Ukrainian refugees, TCN citizens, the local population, survivors of gender-based violence, people with serious mental illness, unaccompanied children, and the Roma community, with consultations in Russian, Ukrainian, and Romanian.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The content states that information on how to enroll a child in primary education and the required documents is available, but it does not list the specific documents.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: One can learn more about the education system in Romania by accessing the 'More information' link provided in the education section.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Sus Inima provides free basic food and hygiene products, therapies, medical services, Romanian and English language courses, temporary accommodation, a day center, and educational infrastructure for Ukrainian children.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Women's Center offers support in accessing reproductive health services, navigating the health system, and services dedicated to victims of domestic violence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: Individuals can access free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social HIV services through specialist doctors from 10 Regional HIV Centers in Romania and with the support of Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.
